de.esoco.gwt.shared

Class ServiceException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • de.esoco.gwt.shared.ServiceException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationException

    public class ServiceException
extends java.lang.Exception
    The base class for all exceptions that can be thrown by services.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ServiceException

        public ServiceException(java.lang.String sMessage,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> rErrorParameters,
                        de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Creates a new instance of a recoverable service exception. A recoverable exception will return TRUE from the isRecoverable() method. It provides additional information about the causing problem by returning a map containing the causing parameters and a description of the error from the method getErrorParameters() and optionally an updated process state from getProcessState().
        Parameters:
        sMessage - The error message
        rErrorParameters - The list of error
        rProcessState - An updated process state that reflects parameter updates for the signaled error

      • ServiceException

        protected ServiceException(java.lang.String sMessage,
                           boolean bRecoverable)
        A constructor for subclasses that need to indicate a recoverable state.
        See Also:
        ServiceException(String)

    • Method Detail

      • getCauseMessage

        public final java.lang.String getCauseMessage()
        Returns the message of the root cause exception of this instance. This is needed for clients because the chain of cause messages is lost on GWT serialization.
        Returns:
        The causing exception's message or NULL for none

      • getErrorParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getErrorParameters()
        Returns the optional parameters of a recoverable exception. The result is a map of strings that contains the erroneous parameters as the keys and the associated error message as the values.
        Returns:
        A map from erroneous parameters to error messages (NULL for none)

      • getProcessState

        public de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState getProcessState()
        Returns an optional process state that is associated with this exception.
        Returns:
        The process state or NULL for none

      • isRecoverable

        public boolean isRecoverable()
        Indicates whether this exception is recoverable.
        Returns:
        TRUE if this
